In three sentences
Comments
Campus police are always on patrol!!
Great art program, they do beautiful work and sell it there on campus.
A lot of friendly people and staff!
A lot opeople
I am in my 5th year of college so I already have my share of student loans, while still finishing my basic core classes. This school is a great deal.
I like to go downtown for fun. There are a lot of shops and dining to meet new people. The food is great!
The cafeteria has a lot of variety, lots of fruits and vegetables!
There are no dorms at CNM.

The professors are very passionate about their area of study and are ready to teach students in any way they will succeed. They are available for questions, able to work with different learning types, and help with concerns. Friendly as well!
Central NM Community College is a great place to learn. It is my advice to keep an open mind and you will succeed.
This will be the end of my first year at CNM, and it has been amazing. The professors truly care about my education and my progress. The class sizes are perfect for learning and growing in any field.
pageTitle: Central New Mexico Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {37564=Central New Mexico Community College was the BEST decision I have ever made. I enjoy school so much I will be graduating with honors December 2013. I love school, I am transferring to University of New Mexico to continue my education., 16959=There are many things you can do for fun. There are movie theaters, golf courts, roller skating rinks, bowling, hiking, tramway rides, and many other fun activities that go on year round in the Albuquerque metro area. The balloon fiesta is always the main attraction every October. It is awesome., 289216=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 265961=I discovered this year that taking morning and night classes at CNM main campus in Albuquerque when I live in Rio Rancho is not very smart. If you are a CNM student and live more than 20 minute from main campus do not take classes first thing in the morning or after 4:30. The traffic is horrendous this time of day. Also finding parking at main campus is very tricky. Around 8 am the parking lots tend to fill up and don't start emptying until around 6-7 pm.}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Virginia from Albuquerque, NM 05/07/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 out of 3 people found this review useful. 3 of 74 Categories Comments Bang for the buck Most teachers are very good, although some have checked out a bit. But the cost is so low that even a bad class isn't a total waste. Am enjoying being here I enjoy the class size and variety of online classes. But since my goals require a 4 year degree and Masters, I need to attend UNM to continue. Am learning a lot I have had some amazing professors here. In general this college has really challenged me and given me an education closer to what I would expect from a University, and in some cases better than you find at UNM. Login to rate or flag
